alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Baldwin. In northwest Florida, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 111 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Gonzalez, Pace, Milton, Goulding, Bagdad, Myrtle Grove, Molino, Pea Ridge, Floridatown, Point Baker, Roeville, Harp, Mulat, Galt City, Chumuckla and Quintette.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
